message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DC

This paper is about handling rich morphology in neural machine translation (NMT), which is a topic related to natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to NLP and ML for natural language understanding and generation. 

The paper also compares different methods of subword construction, which is a topic related to ML and data preprocessing. Therefore, the second most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics related to ML algorithms and techniques. 

The paper also proposes a novel method based on a derivational dictionary, which is a topic related to linguistics and language modeling. Therefore, the third most likely sub-category is cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which covers topics related to intelligent systems and language modeling. 

The paper also evaluates the performance of different methods using automatic measures, which is a topic related to ML and evaluation metrics. Therefore, the fourth most likely sub-category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which covers topics related to ML and optimization algorithms. 

Finally, the paper discusses a simple pre-processing step for improving the performance of one of the methods, which is a topic related to data preprocessing and optimization. Therefore, the fifth most likely sub-category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing),
